hero.title: Payroll Preparation That
hero.subtitle: From verified work sessions to export-ready timesheets. Overtime calculated. Project costs tracked. Hours that match your accounting software on the first try.

problem.title: The Payroll Problem Nobody Talks About
problem.subtitle: Your hourly rates are correct. Your work hours are correct. So why does payday feel like a hostage negotiation?

card1.title: The Time Tracking Mess
card1.description: Your tech logged 8 hours in their notebook. The time clock says 7.5 hours. GPS shows they arrived at 7:45am. Which number do you pay?

card2.title: The Allocation Mystery
card2.description: Sarah worked three buildings yesterday. How do you split her 8 hours across three different project budgets accurately? Most owners guess.

card3.title: The Overtime Confusion
card3.description: Dave hit 40 hours on Thursday afternoon. He worked Friday. Does overtime trigger daily or weekly? At 1.5x or 2x? Your spreadsheet doesn't know.

benefits.title: Who Benefits from Proper Payroll Data
benefits.subtitle: The Payroll module serves different needs for each role in your rope access operation.

benefit1.title: No more random e-transfers.
benefit1.description: "I thought I paid Dave on Friday" becomes a searchable, documented history. Every payment is tracked. Every discrepancy has a reason attached.

benefit2.title: Stop subsidizing client projects.
benefit2.description: With project attribution on every hour, you finally know which buildings are profitable. That "good client" paying net-60 might actually be costing you money.

benefit3.title: QuickBooks exports that work.
benefit3.description: The CSV export matches your payroll software's import format. No reformatting. No manual re-entry. No transcription errors.

benefit1.title: Review without the paper shuffle.
benefit1.description: Your employees across multiple projects, multiple buildings, multiple shifts. The payroll view shows every work session organized by employee and pay period. Review and approve from one screen.

benefit2.title: Catch discrepancies before payday.
benefit2.description: GPS verification and project attribution make anomalies obvious. A technician logged 8 hours at Building A but was scheduled for Building B? You see it immediately.

benefit3.title: Historical access for audits.
benefit3.description: Previous pay periods stay accessible. When someone questions hours from three months ago, you pull the data in seconds.

benefit1.title: Your hours are accurate.
benefit1.description: GPS verification captures your actual time on site. No more discrepancies between what you logged and what the owner calculated.

benefit2.title: See where your time goes.
benefit2.description: Every work session shows which project you were assigned to. Your 8-hour day might split across three buildings. The breakdown is clear.

benefit3.title: Overtime calculated correctly.
benefit3.description: The system applies your company's overtime rules automatically. Daily trigger at 8 hours, weekly trigger at 40, whatever the configuration. No manual math required.

benefit1.title: Labor documentation on demand.
benefit1.description: Need to verify how many technician hours were spent on your building last quarter? The data exists and exports cleanly.

benefit2.title: Budget validation simplified.
benefit2.description: You contracted for 200 hours of annual maintenance. The project attribution shows exactly how many hours have been logged against your building.

benefit3.title: Audit-ready records.
benefit3.description: Insurance, compliance, or internal review requirements? Work session data with GPS verification provides the documentation trail.

keyFeatures.title: Key Features
keyFeatures.subtitle: Every feature exists to eliminate the gap between field work and payroll processing.

feature1.title: Pay Period Configuration
feature1.description: Choose weekly, bi-weekly, semi-monthly, or monthly pay periods. The system auto-generates period boundaries. Work sessions group into the correct pay period automatically.

feature2.title: GPS-Verified Time Data
feature2.description: Hours come from verified work sessions, not self-reported notebooks. Clock-in location confirms the technician was actually at the job site. Eliminates disputes.

feature3.title: Configurable Overtime Rules
feature3.description: Set daily triggers (default 8 hours), weekly triggers (default 40 hours), or custom thresholds. Multipliers adjust from 1.5x to 3x. Disable overtime entirely if needed.

feature4.title: Project Attribution
feature4.description: Every work session links to a specific project. Your payroll view shows which building, which job type, how many hours. Essential for job costing and future bid accuracy.

feature5.title: Billable vs Non-Billable Tracking
feature5.description: Distinguish revenue-generating client hours from operational costs. Travel, equipment maintenance, training, weather delays. Know your true labor cost.

feature6.title: Export Capabilities
feature6.description: CSV export for payroll software integration (QuickBooks, ADP, Gusto). PDF timesheet reports for records. Employee-level detail and project cost breakdowns available.

results.title: Measurable Results
results.subtitle: Concrete improvements you'll see from day one.

result1.title: Time Savings
result1.description: The manual pen-and-calculator method consumes 6-10 hours per payroll run. OnRopePro reduces this to 30-45 minutes. For bi-weekly payroll, that's approximately 260 hours saved annually. Time that goes back into running your business.

result2.title: Error Reduction
result2.description: Conflicting systems (notebooks, time clocks, spreadsheets) create discrepancies. Single-source-of-truth data eliminates reconciliation disputes. Corrections drop dramatically when the data is accurate from the start.

result3.title: Job Costing Accuracy
result3.description: Without project attribution, you don't know why jobs run over budget. With it, you see exactly where hours went. Operators report quoting accuracy improves because they're working from actual historical data instead of estimates.

result4.title: Accounting Cleanliness
result4.description: Random correction payments create unexplained transactions. Clean exports mean every dollar is documented before it leaves the system. Bookkeeper reconciliation time drops.

integration.title: Module Integration Points
integration.subtitle: The Payroll & Financial module connects with other OnRopePro modules to create a complete data pipeline from field work to payroll export.

module1.title: Work Sessions & Time Tracking
module1.description: Primary data source. Every clock-in and clock-out creates work session data that flows directly into payroll aggregation.

module2.title: Employee Management
module2.description: Rate and role lookup. Hourly rate pulls from the employee profile at the time of the work session. Mid-project rate changes are handled correctly.

module3.title: Project Management
module3.description: Project attribution source. Work sessions link to projects, enabling labor cost tracking per building and per job type.

module4.title: Scheduling & Calendar
module4.description: Shift assignment context. Scheduled shifts provide expected hours for comparison with actual hours worked. Discrepancies become visible.

module5.title: Safety Compliance
module5.description: Work eligibility verification. Harness inspection and certification requirements verify before clock-in is allowed. Failed inspections block work sessions.

module6.title: Analytics & Reporting
module6.description: Payroll data feeds into company-wide analytics. Labor costs, productivity metrics, and budget tracking all derive from the same source of truth.

impact.title: Stop Dreading Payday
impact.paragraph1: Payday shouldn't consume your afternoon. It shouldn't involve a calculator, a pen, and 48 pages of printouts spread across your desk. It definitely shouldn't result in random e-transfers that confuse your bookkeeper and corrections that take longer than the original processing.
impact.paragraph2: Right now, payroll is probably the most hated task on your calendar. You put it off. You run late. Your employees start budgeting around "getting paid late." That culture of lateness bleeds into everything else.
impact.paragraph3: When payroll takes 30 minutes instead of 6 hours, you stop avoiding it. You run on time. Your team notices. The professional standards you set for payroll extend to project timelines, client communications, and safety documentation.
impact.paragraph4: You get back 260+ hours per year. That's six full work weeks. Time currently spent circling numbers that could go toward bidding new contracts, managing client relationships, or simply being present for the work you actually want to do.

faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.subtitle: Common questions about the Payroll & Financial module.

faq1.question: Does OnRopePro calculate my taxes and deductions?
faq1.answer: No. OnRopePro prepares payroll-ready timesheet data for export. Actual payroll calculations (CPP, EI, tax withholding, Social Security, Medicare) happen in your payroll processing software (QuickBooks, ADP, Gusto, etc.). OnRopePro handles time aggregation and export, not tax compliance.

faq2.question: What pay period options are available?
faq2.answer: Weekly, bi-weekly, semi-monthly, and monthly. The system generates period boundaries automatically based on your selection.

faq3.question: How does overtime calculation work?
faq3.answer: You configure the rules: daily trigger (default 8 hours), weekly trigger (default 40 hours), and multiplier (1.5x, 2x, etc.). The system applies these rules automatically to every work session. You can disable overtime entirely if your pay structure doesn't include it.

faq4.question: What format does the export use?
faq4.answer: CSV for payroll software import. PDF for printable timesheet records. Both include employee-level detail and project attribution.

faq5.question: Who can see payroll data?
faq5.answer: Users with the canAccessFinancials permission. This is granted through the role-based permission system. Technicians see their own hours but not compensation rates or other employees' data.

faq6.question: What happens if a work session is missing or incorrect?
faq6.answer: Supervisors with appropriate permissions can review and adjust work sessions before timesheet approval. All adjustments are logged with reasons for audit purposes.

faq7.question: Can I see historical pay periods?
faq7.answer: Yes. Previous pay periods remain accessible. Filter by date range to pull data from any past period.

faq8.question: Does project attribution work if a technician works at multiple buildings in one day?
faq8.answer: Yes. Each work session links to a specific project. If a technician clocks into Building A for 4 hours, then Building B for 4 hours, both sessions show separately with their respective project attribution.

faq9.question: What about non-billable time like travel between sites?
faq9.answer: Non-billable work sessions track hours that cannot be charged to clients (travel, training, equipment maintenance, weather delays). The payroll view shows both billable and non-billable hours so you know your true labor cost.

faq10.question: Is there an approval workflow before export?
faq10.answer: Yes. Timesheets can be reviewed and approved before export. Approved timesheets generate clean export files. The workflow prevents exporting data that hasn't been verified.

safeWorkPractices.title: Safe Work Practices
safeWorkPractices.templatesDescription: Pre-built templates covering essential safety topics for rope access operations
safeWorkPractices.templateNoticeText: These are template Safe Work Practices. Review and customize them to match your specific company policies and operational requirements. Ensure all employees are trained and acknowledge these practices before work commences.

ppe.title: Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
ppe.description: Guidelines for proper selection, use, and maintenance of personal protective equipment in rope access operations.
principles: PPE is the last line of defense - engineering controls come first
All PPE must be inspected before each use
PPE must be appropriate for the specific hazard
Damaged or expired PPE must be immediately replaced
Workers must be trained in proper PPE use

fallProtection.title: Fall Protection
fallProtection.description: Essential practices for preventing falls from height during rope access operations.
principles: Falls from height are the leading cause of fatalities in construction
Dual rope systems provide redundancy for safety
Anchor points must be independently tested and certified
100% tie-off is required when working at height
Fall arrest equipment must limit free fall to 6 feet or less

manualHandling.title: Manual Handling
manualHandling.description: Safe practices for lifting, carrying, and moving materials during work operations.
principles: Back injuries are often preventable with proper technique
Use mechanical aids whenever possible
Team lifts for loads over 25kg
Plan the lift before attempting
Keep loads close to your body

heatCold.title: Heat and Cold Stress Prevention
heatCold.description: Managing environmental temperature extremes to protect worker health and safety.
principles: Both heat and cold can cause serious medical emergencies
Acclimatization takes time - build up exposure gradually
Hydration is critical in both hot and cold environments
Recognize early warning signs of heat/cold stress
Implement work-rest cycles in extreme conditions

chemical.title: Chemical Safety
chemical.description: Safe handling, storage, and use of cleaning chemicals and hazardous substances.
principles: All chemicals can be hazardous if misused
Safety Data Sheets (SDS) contain critical safety information
Never mix chemicals unless specifically authorized
Use appropriate PPE when handling chemicals
Store chemicals according to compatibility requirements

toolEquipment.title: Tool and Equipment Safety
toolEquipment.description: Safe practices for using hand tools, power tools, and equipment at height.
principles: Tools can become deadly projectiles if dropped from height
All tools must be tethered when working at height
Power tools require additional safety precautions
Inspect tools before each use
Use the right tool for the job

electrical.title: Electrical Safety
electrical.description: Preventing electrical hazards and injuries during rope access work.
principles: Electricity can kill instantly
Maintain safe clearances from power lines
Use GFCI protection for all power tools
Never work on live electrical systems
Report any electrical hazards immediately

emergency.title: Emergency Response
emergency.description: Procedures for responding to emergencies and rescue situations.
principles: Every worker must know emergency procedures
Communication is critical in emergencies
Rescue plans must be in place before work begins
First aid supplies must be readily accessible
Practice emergency drills regularly

hero.tagline: Conflict detection that actually works. Two calendar views that show you everything. Time-off that integrates automatically.
hero.description: The scheduling system that prevents Monday morning disasters before they happen.

problem.title: The Problem With Spreadsheet Scheduling
problem.scenario: "Next thing you know, Dave is booked at two places to start two new projects on Monday."
problem.cause: Spreadsheets have no conflict detection. When you're rushing to fill spots on Friday afternoon, mistakes happen. You book the same person twice. You schedule someone during their vacation. You create overlapping assignments without realizing it.
problem.solution: The consequences cascade: pulled crews, delayed projects, broken promises, and the stress that comes with scrambling to fix what shouldn't have broken in the first place.

features.title: How OnRopePro Solves This
features.subtitle: Three systems working together to eliminate scheduling conflicts before they happen.

conflictDetection.title: Automatic Conflict Detection
conflictDetection.description: Before any assignment is created, the system checks for problems. Every time.
conflictDetection.item1: Existing assignments on the same dates
conflictDetection.item4: Warning with option to override (you stay in control)

dualCalendar.title: Dual Calendar System
dualCalendar.description: Two views that answer different questions. Use both together for complete visibility.
dualCalendar.item1: Project Calendar - All projects on a timeline with assigned employees
dualCalendar.item2: Resource Timeline - Each employee as a row, showing their workload
dualCalendar.item4: Month, week, and day views available

projectIntegrated.title: Time-Off Integration
projectIntegrated.description: Approved time-off automatically blocks scheduling. No more "he's in Mexico" surprises.
projectIntegrated.item1: 10 leave types (vacation, sick, personal, bereavement, etc.)
projectIntegrated.item2: Employee requests, manager approvals with reason
projectIntegrated.item3: Approved time-off appears on both calendars
projectIntegrated.item4: Conflict warning if you try to schedule during approved leave

stakeholders.title: Who Benefits
stakeholders.subtitle: The scheduling module helps everyone in the organization.

owners.title: For Company Owners
owners.benefit1Desc: Conflict detection catches double-bookings before they happen. No more 6am phone calls. No more pulling people from other buildings to cover mistakes.
owners.benefit2Desc1: The most important days are properly staffed because you can see conflicts before they're created.
owners.benefit2Desc2: One saved contract renewal pays for the software for years.
owners.benefit3Desc: Who's working where. Who's on vacation. Where the gaps are. Visual clarity instead of spreadsheet guessing.

ops.title: For Operations Managers
ops.benefit1Desc1: Resource Timeline shows each employee's schedule on a single row.
ops.benefit1Desc2: See who's booked solid and who has gaps. Distribute work fairly.
ops.benefit2Desc1: Stop going project to project to see where people are.
ops.benefit2Desc2: See crew distribution from your desk.
ops.benefit3Desc1: Employees submit requests. You approve or deny with reason.

technicians.title: For Technicians
technicians.benefit1Title: Know where you're going before Monday.
technicians.benefit1Desc1: Permission-based schedule visibility lets you see your upcoming assignments through the app.
technicians.benefit1Desc2: No more waiting until Monday morning to find out your location.
technicians.benefit2Desc1: When your assignment changes, the updated schedule is visible immediately.
technicians.benefit2Desc2: Fewer wasted trips to the wrong building.

buildingMgrs.title: For Building Managers
buildingMgrs.benefit1Title: Your crews show up when scheduled.
buildingMgrs.benefit1Desc1: Conflict prevention and visual scheduling help rope access companies ensure first days are properly staffed.
buildingMgrs.benefit1Desc2: Fewer no-shows mean fewer embarrassing calls to residents.
buildingMgrs.benefit2Desc: "Is your crew on-site today?" The company owner can answer immediately because they see exactly which buildings have crews scheduled.

propertyMgrs.title: For Property Managers
propertyMgrs.benefitDesc: When the rope access company confirms a start date, you can trust that their crew scheduling actually supports it. Professional operations use professional systems.

keyFeatures.title: Key Features
keyFeatures.subtitle: Everything you need to schedule crews confidently and prevent conflicts before they happen.

conflictEngine.title: Conflict Detection Engine
conflictEngine.desc1: Before any assignment is created, the system checks for existing assignments, approved time-off, and date overlaps.
conflictEngine.desc2: Conflicts display detailed warnings. You can override if necessary, but you cannot accidentally create scheduling disasters.

projectCalendar.title: Project Calendar (Job Calendar)
projectCalendar.desc1: View all projects on a timeline with color-coded blocks. See multi-day spans at a glance. Identify gaps in scheduling.
projectCalendar.desc2: View projects even if no one is assigned yet. Month, week, and day views available.

resourceTimeline.title: Resource Timeline (Employee Calendar)
resourceTimeline.desc1: Each row represents one employee. Horizontal bars show where they are assigned. Gaps are visually obvious.
resourceTimeline.desc2: Time-off displayed inline. See workload distribution across your entire crew instantly.

dragDrop.title: Drag-and-Drop Assignment

dragDrop.desc2: Confirm the date range in the popup. Assignment created with conflict checking automatic.

timeOff.title: Time-Off Management

permissions.title: Permission-Based Visibility

owner1.trigger: "Next thing you know, Dave is booked at two places to start two new projects on Monday."
owner1.pain: Friday afternoon rushing to fill spots for next week. Golf tournament in an hour. You're throwing names right, left, center. Dave gets booked on two jobs starting the same day. You don't catch it until Sunday night when you're reviewing the schedule.
owner1.example: Now you have to call your ops manager during his family barbecue to change everything. The stress cascades through the organization.
owner1.solution: Automatic conflict detection prevents the double-booking in the first place. The moment you try to assign Dave to a second project on the same day, the system displays a warning with details about his existing assignment.
owner1.benefit: The conflict cannot be created accidentally. Zero Sunday night surprises. Zero Monday morning scrambles.

owner2.trigger: "You don't show up on the first day, especially on a new contract. It's just bad news all around."
owner2.pain: The property manager is waiting. Building manager has keys ready. Residents got notices in the elevator two weeks ago. Everyone expects you on December 15th.
owner2.example: Double-booking means pulling people from other buildings to cover. Now you're behind everywhere. Techs working alone (safety violation). And the client who was waiting? They remember.
owner2.solution: Visual calendar shows all project start dates with assigned technicians. Resource Timeline reveals if critical first days are understaffed. You can see at a glance whether your most important days are properly covered.
owner2.benefit: The contract renewal you protect pays for the software. One saved $30,000 annual contract covers years of subscription fees.

owner3.trigger: "A guy would book two weeks vacation and then Jeff would just forget and book him at a building."
owner3.pain: Approved vacation sitting in an email or a text. Then forgotten when scheduling next week. Monday morning: "Where's Dave?" "He's in Mexico."
owner3.example: Pull people from other buildings. Again. The vacation that was approved two months ago creates chaos because nobody remembered to check before scheduling.
owner3.solution: Approved time-off automatically blocks scheduling for those dates. When you try to assign someone on approved vacation, the system displays a conflict warning. The employee appears as unavailable in the drag-and-drop panel.
owner3.benefit: The vacation you approved two months ago still protects that employee from being scheduled. Zero "he's in Mexico" surprises.

ops1.trigger: "I had to go from project to project and look at the guys on the rope and take notes of where they're at compared to yesterday."
ops1.pain: No single view of crew workload. Some techs overworked, others sitting idle. You don't know until you're physically visiting each site.
ops1.example: Imbalanced assignments burn out your best people while newer techs don't get enough experience. Driving between sites just to understand who's where.
ops1.solution: Resource Timeline shows each employee's schedule on a single row. See who's booked solid versus who has gaps. Visual representation of workload across your entire crew.
ops1.benefit: Make proactive decisions about workload distribution before anyone gets burned out. Balance assignments from your desk instead of driving between sites.

tech1.trigger: "They would be told on Monday, go to this address. You go to this address."
tech1.pain: No visibility into your own schedule. You find out Monday morning where you're supposed to be. Hard to plan your week. Hard to plan your life.
tech1.example: Show up expecting to work at one building, then get redirected mid-morning. Wasted driving time. Confusion about what gear to bring.
tech1.solution: Permission-based schedule visibility. If the employer enables it, you see your upcoming assignments through the app. You know where you're going before Monday.
tech1.benefit: Changes are visible immediately. Plan your commute. Pack the right gear. Fewer wasted trips to the wrong building.

bm1.trigger: "You don't show up on the first day where everybody's waiting for you. It's just bad news all around."
bm1.pain: You prepared for the rope access crew. Notices went to residents. Keys are ready. Access arranged. They don't show up.
bm1.example: Your phone starts ringing. Angry residents. You look incompetent to your board. The contractor's scheduling failure becomes your reputation problem.
bm1.solution: OnRopePro's conflict prevention helps rope access companies ensure first days are properly staffed. Professional systems create reliable contractors.
bm1.benefit: Your reputation protected. Work with companies that operate like professionals and show up when they say they will.

zeroEmergencies.description: Monday morning emergencies from double-booking. Zero 6am phone calls. Zero Sunday barbecue interruptions.

contractsProtected.description: Contract renewals protected. First-day no-shows kill renewals. One saved annual contract pays for the software for years.

faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.subtitle: Common questions about scheduling and calendar functionality.

q1.question: Can technicians see their own schedule?
q1.answer: Yes, if you enable the permission. Company owners control whether technicians can view their own upcoming assignments. You can also enable viewing the full team schedule for supervisors and managers.

q2.question: What happens if I try to assign someone who's on vacation?
q2.answer: The system displays a conflict warning showing the approved time-off dates. You see the warning before the assignment is created. You can override if necessary, but you cannot accidentally schedule someone during approved vacation.

q3.question: Can I still make scheduling decisions if there's a conflict?
q3.answer: Yes. Conflict warnings display details and give you the option to proceed or cancel. The system prevents accidents, not decisions. You remain in control.

q4.question: How does the calendar connect to projects?
q4.answer: When you create a project with date range and assigned employees, calendar entries generate automatically. Change the project dates and the calendar updates. One system, one truth.

q5.question: What time-off types are supported?
q5.answer: 10 leave types: vacation, sick leave, personal leave, bereavement, jury duty, medical leave, family emergency, unpaid leave, training/development, and military leave. Each displays distinctly on the calendar.

q6.question: Can I see both projects and employees in one view?
q6.answer: The dual calendar system provides two complementary views. Project Calendar shows all jobs on a timeline. Resource Timeline shows employee workloads by row. Use both together for complete visibility.

q7.question: How does drag-and-drop work?
q7.answer: Select an employee from the panel. Drag onto the project calendar at the desired date. System highlights valid drop zones. Confirm date range in the popup. Assignment created with automatic conflict checking.

q8.question: What if someone calls in sick last minute?
q8.answer: You can update their status to sick leave for the current day. The Resource Timeline immediately shows them as unavailable. You can then see who's available to cover based on their current assignments.

q9.question: Is there mobile access for viewing schedules?
q9.answer: Yes. The schedule is viewable through the mobile app. Technicians with schedule visibility permissions can check their assignments from their phone.

problem.title: The Quoting Problem
problem.scenario: You visit the building. Count drops per elevation. Photograph access points. Drive back to the office. Pull up your spreadsheet template. Calculate hours from drop counts. Apply your rate. Format the PDF. Email it three days later.
problem.notes: Your competitor quoted the same building two hours after the site visit.
problem.mistake: Your spreadsheet formula references the wrong cell. Your quote is $1,200 lower than it should be. You discover this after signing the contract.
problem.competitor: Your technician mentions pricing to the property manager during the assessment. The property manager uses this to negotiate you down before you submit the formal quote.
problem.solution: OnRopePro eliminates these problems by separating site assessment from pricing visibility, automating calculations with service-specific formulas, and enabling same-day quote delivery.

employer1.trigger: "I sent my new tech to quote a building. He came back with the client's budget expectations and quoted below our minimum margin."
employer1.pain: You need people gathering site data. The moment they have quoting access, they see your pricing strategy. Your tech tells the property manager "usually runs about $X per drop" based on what he saw in the system.
employer1.example: Your tech mentions pricing to the property manager. Property manager uses that to negotiate you down. Your margin compresses before you even submit the official quote.
employer1.solution: Financial Access permission separates site assessment from pricing visibility. Technician enters drops, elevations, building details, photos. Pricing fields do not exist in his interface.
employer1.benefit: Your pricing strategy stays private until you are ready to present the formal quote. No accidental disclosure, no margin compression from employee conversations.

employer2.trigger: "I quoted a complex at $4,800. After we started, I realized I forgot Tower C in my calculations. We did $6,200 of work for $4,800."
employer2.pain: Four towers, different elevations, varying drop counts per elevation. You are calculating on your phone between site visits. Your notes say "Tower C: same as Tower A" but Tower C actually has 40% more drops.
employer2.example: You discover the error after the contract is signed. You either eat a $1,400 loss or look incompetent asking to renegotiate.
employer2.solution: Service-specific formulas eliminate manual calculation errors. Enter drops per elevation for each tower. System calculates total hours from drops and your daily productivity target automatically.
employer2.benefit: No calculator errors, no forgotten buildings, no surprise losses when you realize your math was wrong. Quote total updates automatically as you enter data.

employer3.trigger: "Property manager chose my competitor because they sent their quote three hours after the site visit. Mine took two days."
employer3.pain: Your tech assesses the building Tuesday morning. Takes notes on paper. Texts you drop counts. You enter data into spreadsheet that night. Create PDF Wednesday afternoon. Email it Thursday morning.
employer3.example: Property manager already signed with the company that sent their quote Tuesday at 2pm. They beat you by 48 hours.
employer3.solution: Mobile quote creation eliminates the assessment-to-quote delay. Technician completes site assessment on phone. You open the quote later, add pricing, generate PDF, send.
employer3.benefit: Same-day quote delivery becomes standard instead of exceptional. You stop losing opportunities to competitors who quote faster.

employer4.trigger: "I have twelve quotes in various stages but no idea which ones are actually moving forward."
employer4.pain: Quotes live in email folders, spreadsheets, and your memory. Someone asks "what's our pipeline look like?" and you spend twenty minutes reconstructing status from scattered sources.
employer4.example: Client calls about "that quote from last month." You find three draft quotes from around that time. Neither you nor the client remembers which one was the real discussion.
employer4.solution: Visual Kanban pipeline shows every quote and its current stage. Drag cards between Draft, Submitted, Under Review, Negotiation, Won, Lost columns.
employer4.benefit: Instant pipeline visibility. Monthly sales reviews take minutes instead of hours. Nothing forgotten because everything is visible in one view.

employer5.trigger: "Quote got approved but creating the project meant re-entering all the building details. My admin made a typo in the address."
employer5.pain: Approved quote has building address, tower configurations, service details, client contacts. Creating the project means re-typing all of this into a different form. Every re-entry creates error opportunity.
employer5.example: Address typo means technicians drive to wrong building. Client receives invoice with wrong address. You look disorganized despite winning the work professionally.
employer5.solution: One-click project conversion. Quote data transfers to new project automatically: address, towers, services, budget hours, contacts. Nothing retyped.
employer5.benefit: Zero double-entry errors. Project creation takes seconds instead of fifteen minutes. Your admin focuses on scheduling instead of data entry.

tech1.trigger: "Boss wants me to gather site data but I feel uncomfortable because I don't know what to say when property managers ask about pricing."
tech1.pain: You are a skilled technician, not a salesperson. Property manager corners you: "So what do you think this will run?" You have no idea. Boss will be angry if you guess wrong.
tech1.example: You give a number based on nothing. Property manager budgets that amount. Your boss's actual quote is 40% higher. Client feels misled. You get blamed.
tech1.solution: Quote interface shows no pricing fields for technicians. You literally cannot see rates or totals. When asked about costs, you honestly say "I just gather the technical details. Pricing comes from the office."
tech1.benefit: No awkward pricing conversations. No accidental commitments. You focus on accurate site assessment. Your competence shows through thorough documentation, not sales skills.

tech2.trigger: "I assessed a building last week and now I can't remember if it was five drops on the north face or six."
tech2.pain: Paper notes get lost or become illegible. Mental notes fade. You visit three buildings on Tuesday and by Friday the details blur together.
tech2.example: Boss asks for clarification. You guess. Quote goes out based on incorrect data. Project starts and reality does not match quote.
tech2.solution: Mobile quote entry with photo attachments. Count drops, photograph each elevation, enter data immediately. Photos serve as permanent verification.
tech2.benefit: Never rely on memory. Never lose notes. Photos prove what you saw. Your assessments become the reliable foundation for accurate quotes.

bm1.trigger: "Three vendors quoted my building. Two sent confusing emails. One sent a professional PDF with clear line items."
bm1.pain: You need to present vendor options to ownership or your board. Confusing quotes make you look like you did not do proper vendor research.
bm1.example: Board member asks "what exactly are we paying for?" Vendor A's email says "window cleaning $4,500." No breakdown. Vendor B's OnRopePro quote shows drops per elevation, estimated hours, per-service pricing.
bm1.solution: OnRopePro quotes export as professional PDFs with itemized scope, tower breakdowns, and service categories. Clear documentation that answers stakeholder questions.
bm1.benefit: You look competent presenting vendor options. Board approvals happen faster when documentation is clear. Vendor selection becomes defensible decision.

bm2.trigger: "The vendor said they'd clean all the windows but their quote only covered the main tower. The penthouse level wasn't included."
bm2.pain: Verbal understanding differs from written scope. Vendor says "all windows" but quote shows tower specifications that exclude certain areas.
bm2.example: Work completes. Penthouse windows still dirty. Vendor says "that wasn't in the quote." You have no documentation to prove otherwise. Conflict ensues.
bm2.solution: Tower-by-tower specifications with elevation counts force explicit scope. Quote shows exactly which towers, which elevations, which services. Nothing implied, everything stated.
bm2.benefit: No scope disputes. Quote document serves as contract reference. When questions arise, you point to the itemized breakdown. Clear expectations from the start.

pm1.trigger: "I manage forty properties and need to compare maintenance quotes across my portfolio. Most vendors send inconsistent formats."
pm1.pain: Every vendor has their own quote format. Some send emails, some send PDFs, some just call with a number. Comparing across properties becomes impossible.
pm1.example: Owner asks "what are we spending on window cleaning across the portfolio?" You spend hours normalizing data from twenty different quote formats into a spreadsheet.
pm1.solution: OnRopePro vendors send consistent quote format with standardized service categories, tower specifications, and pricing breakdowns. Your approved vendors produce comparable documentation.
pm1.benefit: Portfolio analysis becomes possible. Normalize vendor costs across properties. Identify outliers. Negotiate better rates based on volume data.

faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.subtitle: Everything you need to know about the Quoting & Sales Pipeline module.
faqs.q1: How do technicians create quotes without seeing pricing?
faqs.a1: Financial Access permission controls pricing visibility. Users without this permission see quote forms with building data fields only. Drop counts, elevations, photos, notesbut no rate fields or totals. They submit complete site assessments that users with Financial Access then price.
faqs.q2: How do the service-specific pricing formulas work?
faqs.a2: Each service type has its own calculation method. Window cleaning: total drops  daily productivity target = estimated hours. Parkade cleaning: stall count  rate = total. Caulking: linear feet  rate. You configure your own productivity targets and rates. The system calculates automatically.
faqs.q3: Can I customize the quote PDF layout?
faqs.a3: Quote PDFs include your company logo, itemized service breakdown, tower specifications, and total pricing. The format is standardized for professional appearance. Custom branding beyond logo placement is not currently available.
faqs.q4: How does the Kanban pipeline work?
faqs.a4: Quotes appear as cards in columns: Draft, Submitted, Under Review, Negotiation, Won, Lost. Drag cards between columns to update status. Click any card to view full quote details. Filter by date range, service type, or building.
faqs.q5: What happens when I convert a won quote to a project?
faqs.a5: Click "Convert to Project" on a Won quote. Building address, tower configurations, service specifications, budget hours, and client contacts transfer automatically. The new project links back to the original quote for reference.
faqs.q6: Can technicians take photos during site assessment?
faqs.a6: Yes. The mobile quote form includes photo upload for each elevation. Photos attach to the quote and appear in the PDF export. Use photos to verify access points, document complications, and support accurate pricing.
faqs.a7: Add multiple towers within a single quote. Each tower has separate floor counts, drop counts per elevation, and service specifications. Quote total aggregates all towers. Work sessions later allow technicians to select which tower they're working on.
faqs.q8: Can I see quote history for a building?
faqs.a8: Yes. Buildings maintain quote history. View all quotes ever created for a specific address. Compare year-over-year pricing. Reference previous scope when creating new quotes.
faqs.q9: How do I track win rates?
faqs.a9: Pipeline analytics show quotes won vs. lost over time. Filter by service type, building size, or date range. Identify patterns in what you win and lose.
faqs.q10: Can multiple people work on the same quote?
faqs.a10: Yes. Technician creates initial assessment. Office manager reviews and adds client contacts. Owner adds pricing and approves for sending. Each user sees only the fields their permissions allow.
faqs.q11: How fast can I send a quote after site assessment?
faqs.a11: If technician completes mobile assessment and you have pricing ready, you can generate and send PDF within minutes of their submission. Same-day quoting becomes standard practice.
faqs.q12: What if I need to revise a submitted quote?
faqs.a12: Create a new version from the existing quote. Previous version is preserved for audit trail. Send the updated version to the client. Quote history shows all versions.
faqs.q13: Can building managers see our quotes directly?
faqs.a13: You control quote delivery. Export PDF and email it, or send directly through the system. Building managers see only what you explicitly share. Internal draft quotes remain private.
faqs.q14: How does this integrate with project management?
faqs.a14: Won quotes convert to projects. Budget hours from the quote become project budget. Actual hours tracked during work sessions compare against quoted estimate. You see if jobs ran over or under budget.
faqs.a15: Permission controls determine who can move quotes to Submitted status. Configure so only owners or managers can finalize and send quotes. Technicians create drafts that require approval.

hero.title: Complaints handled while your crews

problem.title: The Complaint Problem Nobody Budgets For
problem.scenario: A resident in unit 1247 emails about streaks on her window. A week later, she calls the building manager. The building manager calls you. You check your notebook. Maybe the email got lost. Maybe it didn't.
problem.waste: Now three people are spending time on something that might have been resolved in 10 minutes if anyone had known about it while the crew was still in the building.
problem.cost: That 10-minute fix? It becomes a half-day labor cost.
problem.returnVisit: Packing equipment, loading the van, driving across town, rigging ropes for one window, cleaning it, derigging, driving back. You've done the math. You know what those return visits cost.
problem.multiply: And that's just one complaint. During busy season, multiply it by buildings, by units, by the residents who give up entirely and complain on social media instead.
problem.solution: OnRopePro's Resident Portal puts feedback in front of your team while crews are still on-site. Residents submit issues with photos. Your supervisor sees a notification. The technician already rigged on that elevation flips their rope and checks the window. Problem solved in minutes, not days.

employers.benefit1Desc: When complaints come in a week after the job, you're sending someone back. Real-time feedback means issues get addressed while crews are still on-site. One prevented return visit per month pays for the entire system.
employers.benefit2Title: Win contracts by demonstrating operational excellence.
employers.benefit2Desc: When a property manager compares your bid against a competitor, show them your resolution time metrics. You handle feedback systematically. They rely on phone calls and emails. The choice becomes obvious.
employers.benefit3Title: Stop drowning in complaint phone calls.
employers.benefit3Desc: Every complaint phone call interrupts work, requires documentation, and needs follow-up. The mental load of tracking dozens of open issues across multiple buildings disappears when the system organizes everything automatically.

operations.title: For Operations Managers
operations.benefit1Title: See all open issues per building in one view.
operations.benefit1Desc: Five complaints come in for Building A on Monday, three more on Wednesday. Batch your deficiency visits efficiently because you can see what's open and where without reconstructing it from emails and voicemails.
operations.benefit2Desc: A resident claims their window was never cleaned. Without documentation, you redo the work. With photo evidence, timestamps, and internal notes documenting investigation findings, you resolve disputes definitively.

technicians.title: For Technicians
technicians.benefit1Title: Get feedback while you're still on the building.
technicians.benefit1Desc: You finish the west elevation on Tuesday. On Friday, a complaint comes in. Without the portal, you're context-switching back to a building you thought was complete. With real-time feedback, you address issues same-day while the work is fresh and equipment is deployed.
technicians.benefit2Title: Stop getting blamed for things outside your control.
technicians.benefit2Desc: The resident on the floor above watered their plants and dripped onto the window. Without documentation, you look incompetent. Internal notes let you document what actually happened, protecting your professional reputation.

propertyManagers.title: For Property Managers

impact.title: Stop Managing Complaints. Start Managing Growth.
impact.paragraph1: Right now, complaint management looks like this: A phone call interrupts your day. You grab whatever's handy to write it down. You promise to follow up. You add it to the mental list of things that need attention. Multiply that by 50 buildings during busy season and you're drowning in administrative work that produces nothing.
impact.paragraph2: The notebook Tommy used to track complaints still has pages with chicken scratch from phone calls taken while driving. The Google Form helped but created a new problem: sorting 30 submissions from 5 different buildings, then calling each resident individually. The complaint management "system" was whatever got written down that day.
impact.paragraph3: With the Resident Portal, feedback organizes itself.

The half-day return visits become same-day fixes. The phone calls become notifications you handle on your schedule.
impact.paragraph5: What do you do with the hours you get back? Train your crews. Bid on new contracts. Take the call that actually grows your business. The complaint management that used to consume your operations manager's week becomes a check-the-dashboard morning routine.

faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.subtitle: Common questions about the Resident Portal.

q1.question: Can residents see other residents' complaints?
q1.answer: No. Residents can only view and interact with their own feedback submissions. Privacy is protected by design.

q2.question: What happens when a resident moves to a different building?
q2.answer: They update their Strata/LMS number in their profile and enter the new vendor's code. Their account is fully portable. If the new building's vendor uses OnRopePro, they see that vendor's projects. If not, they notice the gap.

q3.question: Can residents reopen closed feedback?
q3.answer: No. Only company staff can reopen closed feedback. If a resident believes the issue persists, they contact their property manager or building manager directly. This prevents endless back-and-forth on resolved issues.

q4.question: Can property managers respond to resident feedback?
q4.answer: No. Property managers can view all feedback and communication history but cannot respond. Only company staff communicate with residents through the system. This keeps property managers informed without requiring their involvement.

q5.question: What's the difference between internal notes and visible replies?
q5.answer: Internal notes are private (staff only) for coordination, investigation findings, and sensitive discussions. Visible replies are seen by the resident for acknowledgment, status updates, and resolution communication. Staff must explicitly toggle a yellow/red checkbox to make a reply visible, preventing accidental exposure.

q6.question: How do residents get the vendor code?
q6.answer: The code is posted on notices in the elevator during projects, provided by the building manager, or included in project communications. One code per company, used for all buildings that company services.

q7.question: Is there one code per building or one code per company?
q7.answer: One code per company. All residents across all buildings serviced by that company use the same vendor code. The Strata/LMS number differentiates which building's projects they see.

q8.question: How long do residents have to submit feedback after a project completes?
q8.answer: 5 business days. This allows time for residents to notice issues while limiting the complaint window to a reasonable period.

q9.question: What happens if feedback sits unread?
q9.answer: Notification badges show pending items in your dashboard. The "Viewed" timestamp is visible to the resident, so they know if no one has opened their feedback. This creates natural accountability.

q10.question: Do residents see when we add internal notes?
q10.answer: No. Internal notes are completely invisible to residents. They only see visible replies and status changes.

hero.tagline: The CSR aggregates harness inspections, document acknowledgments, project compliance, and safety culture into one defensible metric.

problem.title: The Problem With Safety Theater
problem.scenario: "We're safe" isn't evidence. It's a claim.
problem.intro: Every rope access company says they prioritize safety. Property managers hear the same pitch from every contractor. Technicians can't verify employer claims before accepting jobs. And when something goes wrong, "we thought we were safe" doesn't hold up in court.
problem.howDifferent: How is any of this different from what your competitors say?
problem.solution: The Company Safety Rating changes this. Instead of promises, you have a percentage. Instead of assumptions, you have documented compliance. Instead of hoping your safety culture is strong, you can measure it.

features.title: How The CSR Works
features.subtitle: The CSR uses a penalty-based scoring system. You start at 100% and lose points for gaps in four categories.

baseline.title: Company Document Baseline
baseline.description: Upload your Certificate of Insurance, Health & Safety Manual, and Company Policy to establish your baseline. Missing or expired documents trigger immediate penalties.

projectDocs.title: Project Documents Penalty
projectDocs.description: Each project requires four safety documents: Anchor Inspection, Rope Access Plan, Toolbox Meeting, and FLHA. Missing documents on any project reduce your score proportionally.

harness.title: Harness Inspection Penalty
harness.description: Technicians must complete harness inspections before work sessions. The penalty is calculated as percentage of missed inspections against total work sessions over time.

acknowledgment.title: Employee Document Acknowledgment
acknowledgment.description: When you add Safe Work Procedures or Practices, your score decreases until employees sign. This ensures documents are actually reviewed, not just uploaded.

stakeholders.title: Who Benefits From The CSR

employers.benefit3Title: Demonstrate due diligence in liability situations.

Your crew knows the rules because you've told them, but you can't prove they've read and acknowledged specific policies. faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.subtitle: Everything you need to know about the Company Safety Rating.
faqs.q1: How is the starting score calculated?
faqs.a1: New companies start at 75%. Upload your Certificate of Insurance, Health & Safety Manual, and Company Policy to reach 100%. From there, penalties are applied based on ongoing compliance gaps.
faqs.q2: What if I add Safe Work Procedures and my score drops?
faqs.a2: This is intentional. When you add new safety documents, your score temporarily decreases until employees review and sign them. This ensures documents aren't just uploaded and forgotten. Once all employees acknowledge the new procedures, your score returns to full compliance.
faqs.q3: How do harness inspection penalties work?
faqs.a3: The penalty is calculated as a percentage of missed inspections against total work sessions. If you have 1,000 work sessions and miss 10 inspections, that's a 1% penalty. If you're just starting and have 10 sessions with 5 missed inspections, that's a 50% penalty in this category. Consistent compliance over time builds a resilient score.
faqs.q4: Can technicians see my CSR before accepting job offers?
faqs.a4: Yes. Technicians evaluating potential employers can see company CSR ratings. This allows them to make informed decisions about safety before committing to a position.
faqs.a5: Property managers see your overall CSR percentage and a color-coded badge (green, yellow, orange, or red) through their vendor dashboard. They can also see category breakdowns but not your internal operational details.
faqs.a6: Building managers and residents. Building managers handle on-site logistics (keys, water, parking) and don't make vendor selection decisions. Residents seeing safety scores would generate unnecessary concerns without appropriate context.
faqs.q7: What documents are required for each project?
faqs.a7: Four documents: Anchor Inspection (waived for non-rope jobs like parkade pressure washing), Rope Access Plan, Toolbox Meeting, and FLHA. Missing any of these for a project contributes to your project documents penalty.
faqs.q8: Can my score ever reach 100% again after adding employees or documents?
faqs.a8: Yes. 100% is achievable when all company documents are current, all projects have complete documentation, all work sessions have associated harness inspections, and all employees have signed all required documents. The system is designed so perfect scores are difficult to maintain long-term, reflecting that nobody is 100% safe forever.
faqs.q9: How quickly does the score update?
faqs.a9: Real-time. When a technician completes a harness inspection, when an employee signs a document, when a toolbox meeting is logged, the score recalculates immediately.
faqs.q10: What if a new employee joins and hasn't signed anything yet?
faqs.a10: Your score will decrease proportionally until they complete onboarding documentation. This incentivizes prompt completion of new employee safety training and document acknowledgments.
faqs.q11: Can I export CSR data for insurance or regulatory purposes?
faqs.a11: Yes. Generate PDF reports showing employee signatures with timestamps for all safety documents, harness inspection completion records, and toolbox meeting logs. These exports satisfy insurance auditors, WorkSafe inspectors, and IRATA/SPRAT compliance requirements.
faqs.q12: Is the CSR visible to competitors?
faqs.a12: No. Only your own company owners, your technicians (when evaluating job offers), and property managers (when viewing their vendor list) can see your score. Competitors cannot access your CSR.

faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.subtitle: Common questions about user access and authentication.

faq1.question: Can I change someone's permissions after I've set them up?
faq1.answer: Yes. Permissions can be modified anytime from the employee management dashboard. Changes take effect immediately on their next login.

faq2.question: What happens when a building manager leaves?
faq2.answer: Buildings have accounts, not building managers. The new manager changes the building password. Access transfers instantly. The former manager is locked out. No vendor coordination required.

faq3.question: Can technicians see each other's pay rates?
faq3.answer: Only if you grant financial permissions, which you control individually per employee. By default, technicians see only their own work records and assigned projects.

faq4.question: How do residents get access to the portal?
faq4.answer: Building codes. The code appears on elevator notices, gets shared by technicians on-site, or sent by property managers. Resident enters the code, creates an account, instant access to their building's portal.

faq5.question: What if a resident accidentally registers for the wrong unit?
faq5.answer: The system prompts: "There's already an account for this unit. Are you a new resident?" If they confirm, access transfers. If they realize the mistake, they go back and enter the correct unit.

faq6.question: Can building managers see financial information?
faq6.answer: No. Building manager accounts have read-only access to project progress, feedback status, and work history. They cannot see rates, costs, or internal financial data.

faq7.question: How does feedback tracking work?
faq7.answer: Every submission timestamps automatically: when it was opened, when it was acknowledged, when it was resolved. The system calculates average response time and generates exportable reports for strata councils or property managers.

faq8.question: Is my company's data separated from other OnRopePro customers?
faq8.answer: Completely. Multi-tenant architecture means your data exists in a separate partition. Every query, every API call filters to your company only. A security issue with another account cannot expose your information.

faq9.question: What permissions are available?
faq9.answer: 44+ individual permissions across categories: financial (rates, costs, margins), operational (projects, scheduling), safety (inspections, documentation), inventory (equipment, consumables), and employee management (hiring, roles).

faq10.question: Can I create custom roles?
faq10.answer: Yes. While the system includes standard roles (Operations Manager, Supervisor, Technician, etc.), you can create custom positions for unique needs like Inventory Manager or Safety Officer, then assign whatever permissions that role requires.

hero.description: Work sessions flow directly into payroll-ready timesheets. No paper. No calculator. No circling.

problem.title: The Payroll Problem Nobody Admits
problem.line1: You print timesheets. One employee's data spreads across four pages.
problem.line2: Twelve employees means 48 pages minimum. You lay them across your desk, circle hours with a pen, and grab a calculator.
problem.line3: Three hours later, you're still not done. And you've probably made a mistake you won't catch until the employee calls asking why they're short $130.
problem.line4: So you send a quick e-transfer. Problem solved for them. Problem created for your books. Your bookkeeper asks what that random payment was. Now you're explaining instead of running your company.
problem.line5: This chaos doesn't stay contained. When payroll is painful, you put it off. When you're consistently late, your team notices. A culture forms where deadlines are optional. That mindset bleeds into everything.
problem.solution: OnRopePro eliminates manual entry between field work and payroll. Every clock-in becomes payroll data automatically. GPS-verified. Project-attributed. Overtime-calculated. Ready to export.

features.title: From Clock-In to Payroll Export
features.subtitle: The Payroll & Financial module transforms scattered work session data into organized, exportable timesheets without manual intervention.

card1.title: Automatic Aggregation
card1.headline: Every GPS-verified clock-in flows directly into timesheets.
card1.description: The system calculates hours, applies overtime rules, and groups everything by pay period.
card1.item3: Pay period grouping (weekly, bi-weekly, semi-monthly, monthly)

card2.title: Job Costing Visibility
card2.headline: Know exactly how many hours went to each building.
card2.description: Stop underbidding jobs because you can finally see where time actually goes.

card3.title: Export-Ready Output

card3.description: PDF reports for records. No re-keying data.

benefits.title: Who Benefits From This Module
benefits.subtitle: Payroll clarity for everyone in your operation.

benefit1.title: Reclaim 5+ hours every pay period.
benefit1.description: The calculator and pen method costs you 6-10 hours per payroll run. OnRopePro aggregates everything automatically. Select the pay period. Review the totals. Export. Done in 30-45 minutes.

benefit2.title: Stop the random e-transfer scramble.
benefit2.description: When timesheets are wrong, you fix it with quick payments that confuse your books. Accurate data from the start means no corrections. Your bookkeeper gets clean exports every time.

benefit3.title: Quote jobs with confidence.
benefit3.description: You underbid that building by 60 hours because you couldn't see where time went. Project attribution shows exactly how long each job takes. Your next quote includes the hours you actually need.

benefit1.title: Review without the paper shuffle.
benefit1.description: Your employees across multiple projects, multiple buildings, multiple shifts. The payroll view shows every work session organized by employee and pay period. Review and approve from one screen.

benefit2.title: Catch discrepancies before payday.

benefit3.title: Historical access for audits.

benefit1.title: Your hours are accurate.

benefit2.title: See where your time goes.

benefit3.title: Overtime calculated correctly.
benefit3.description: The system applies your company's overtime rules automatically. Daily trigger at 8 hours, weekly trigger at 40, whatever the configuration. No manual math required.

benefit1.title: Labor documentation on demand.
benefit1.description: Need to verify how many technician hours were spent on your building last quarter? The data exists and exports cleanly.

benefit2.title: Budget validation simplified.
benefit2.description: You contracted for 200 hours of annual maintenance. The project attribution shows exactly how many hours have been logged against your building.

benefit3.title: Audit-ready records.

keyFeatures.title: Key Features
keyFeatures.subtitle: Every feature exists to eliminate the gap between field work and payroll processing.

feature1.title: Pay Period Configuration
feature1.description: Choose weekly, bi-weekly, semi-monthly, or monthly pay periods. The system auto-generates period boundaries. Work sessions group into the correct pay period automatically.

feature2.title: GPS-Verified Time Data
feature2.description: Hours come from verified work sessions, not self-reported notebooks. Clock-in location confirms the technician was actually at the job site. Eliminates disputes.

feature3.title: Configurable Overtime Rules
feature3.description: Set daily triggers (default 8 hours), weekly triggers (default 40 hours), or custom thresholds. Multipliers adjust from 1.5x to 3x. Disable overtime entirely if needed.

feature4.title: Project Attribution
feature4.description: Every work session links to a specific project. Your payroll view shows which building, which job type, how many hours. Essential for job costing and future bid accuracy.

feature5.title: Billable vs Non-Billable Tracking
feature5.description: Distinguish revenue-generating client hours from operational costs. Travel, equipment maintenance, training, weather delays. Know your true labor cost.

feature6.title: Export Capabilities
feature6.description: CSV export for payroll software integration (QuickBooks, ADP, Gusto). PDF timesheet reports for records. Employee-level detail and project cost breakdowns available.

results.title: Measurable Results
results.subtitle: Concrete improvements you'll see from day one.

result1.title: Time Savings
result1.description: The manual pen-and-calculator method consumes 6-10 hours per payroll run. OnRopePro reduces this to 30-45 minutes. For bi-weekly payroll, that's approximately 260 hours saved annually. Time that goes back into running your business.

result2.title: Error Reduction
result2.description: Conflicting systems (notebooks, time clocks, spreadsheets) create discrepancies. Single-source-of-truth data eliminates reconciliation disputes. Corrections drop dramatically when the data is accurate from the start.

result3.title: Job Costing Accuracy
result3.description: Without project attribution, you don't know why jobs run over budget. With it, you see exactly where hours went. Operators report quoting accuracy improves because they're working from actual historical data instead of estimates.

result4.title: Accounting Cleanliness
result4.description: Random correction payments create unexplained transactions. Clean exports mean every dollar is documented before it leaves the system. Bookkeeper reconciliation time drops.

integration.title: Module Integration Points
integration.subtitle: The Payroll & Financial module connects with other OnRopePro modules to create a complete data pipeline from field work to payroll export.

module1.title: Work Sessions & Time Tracking
module1.description: Primary data source. Every clock-in and clock-out creates work session data that flows directly into payroll aggregation.

module2.title: Employee Management
module2.description: Rate and role lookup. Hourly rate pulls from the employee profile at the time of the work session. Mid-project rate changes are handled correctly.

module3.title: Project Management
module3.description: Project attribution source. Work sessions link to projects, enabling labor cost tracking per building and per job type.

module4.title: Scheduling & Calendar
module4.description: Shift assignment context. Scheduled shifts provide expected hours for comparison with actual hours worked. Discrepancies become visible.

module5.title: Safety Compliance
module5.description: Work eligibility verification. Harness inspection and certification requirements verify before clock-in is allowed. Failed inspections block work sessions.

module6.title: Analytics & Reporting
module6.description: Payroll data feeds into company-wide analytics. Labor costs, productivity metrics, and budget tracking all derive from the same source of truth.

impact.title: Stop Dreading Payday
impact.paragraph1: Payday shouldn't consume your afternoon. It shouldn't involve a calculator, a pen, and 48 pages of printouts spread across your desk. It definitely shouldn't result in random e-transfers that confuse your bookkeeper and corrections that take longer than the original processing.
impact.paragraph2: Right now, payroll is probably the most hated task on your calendar. You put it off. You run late. Your employees start budgeting around "getting paid late." That culture of lateness bleeds into everything else.
impact.paragraph3: When payroll takes 30 minutes instead of 6 hours, you stop avoiding it. You run on time. Your team notices. The professional standards you set for payroll extend to project timelines, client communications, and safety documentation.
impact.paragraph4: You get back 260+ hours per year. That's six full work weeks. Time currently spent circling numbers that could go toward bidding new contracts, managing client relationships, or simply being present for the work you actually want to do.

faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.subtitle: Common questions about the Payroll & Financial module.

faq1.question: Does OnRopePro calculate my taxes and deductions?
faq1.answer: No. OnRopePro prepares payroll-ready timesheet data for export. Actual payroll calculations (CPP, EI, tax withholding, Social Security, Medicare) happen in your payroll processing software (QuickBooks, ADP, Gusto, etc.). OnRopePro handles time aggregation and export, not tax compliance.

faq2.question: What pay period options are available?
faq2.answer: Weekly, bi-weekly, semi-monthly, and monthly. The system generates period boundaries automatically based on your selection.

faq3.question: How does overtime calculation work?
faq3.answer: You configure the rules: daily trigger (default 8 hours), weekly trigger (default 40 hours), and multiplier (1.5x, 2x, etc.). The system applies these rules automatically to every work session. You can disable overtime entirely if your pay structure doesn't include it.

faq4.question: What format does the export use?
faq4.answer: CSV for payroll software import. PDF for printable timesheet records. Both include employee-level detail and project attribution.

faq5.question: Who can see payroll data?
faq5.answer: Users with the canAccessFinancials permission. This is granted through the role-based permission system. Technicians see their own hours but not compensation rates or other employees' data.

faq6.question: What happens if a work session is missing or incorrect?
faq6.answer: Supervisors with appropriate permissions can review and adjust work sessions before timesheet approval. All adjustments are logged with reasons for audit purposes.

faq7.question: Can I see historical pay periods?
faq7.answer: Yes. Previous pay periods remain accessible. Filter by date range to pull data from any past period.

faq8.question: Does project attribution work if a technician works at multiple buildings in one day?
faq8.answer: Yes. Each work session links to a specific project. If a technician clocks into Building A for 4 hours, then Building B for 4 hours, both sessions show separately with their respective project attribution.

faq9.question: What about non-billable time like travel between sites?
faq9.answer: Non-billable work sessions track hours that cannot be charged to clients (travel, training, equipment maintenance, weather delays). The payroll view shows both billable and non-billable hours so you know your true labor cost.

faq10.question: Is there an approval workflow before export?
faq10.answer: Yes. Timesheets can be reviewed and approved before export. Approved timesheets generate clean export files. The workflow prevents exporting data that hasn't been verified.

newTechs.title: New Techs
newTechs.subtitle: Just got certified. First job. Zero logged hours.
newTechs.problemText1: Every employer wants "experience." But how do you build a track record when your hours are trapped in someone else's spreadsheet?
newTechs.problemText2: You need verifiable work history that employers trust-before you have 1,000 hours.
newTechs.solutionText1: Start logging from day one. Every drop, every building, every hour-verified and portable. By the time you've got 200 hours, you've got proof. Proof that transfers to your L2 assessment. Proof that makes the next employer hire you instead of the other new L1.
newTechs.testimonial: "I had 47 logged hours when I got laid off. Two weeks later, I showed a new employer my verified profile. Started Monday."

experienced.title: Experienced Techs
experienced.subtitle: 500+ hours. Maybe 1,000+. Across 3-4 employers over 6 years.
experienced.problemText1: Your hours are scattered across defunct companies, paper records in storage, and memories that fade. When assessment time comes, you're reconstructing your career from fragments.
experienced.problemText2: Your L3 depends on accuracy. You shouldn't be guessing.
experienced.solutionText1: Photograph your existing logbook pages. The app reads your handwriting, extracts the data, and builds your complete digital record. Every hour from every employer-consolidated, verified, exportable.
experienced.solutionText2: When Apex Rope folded in 2023, 23 of their techs lost access to their hour records. The 7 who had OnRopePro accounts? Their hours were already safe.
experienced.testimonial: "Six employers over 8 years. I had hours scattered across three provinces. Now it's all in one place, and I can prove every single one."

freedom.title: Freedom Seekers
freedom.subtitle: You work where the work is. Vancouver in summer. Calgary for shutdowns. Maybe Seattle or Houston when the market's right.
freedom.problemText1: You're not flaky. You're mobile. But every new city means proving yourself again. References 2,000 miles away. No local reputation. Three hours of paperwork before your first shift.
freedom.problemText2: You need to start earning NOW, not after a week of bureaucratic onboarding.
freedom.solutionText1: Your professional identity travels with you. Your work history from Vancouver? Visible in Seattle. Your certifications? Pre-verified. Your safety rating? Proof you're reliable before you even show up.
freedom.solutionText2: Quit Friday in one city. Start Monday in another. Zero paperwork.
freedom.testimonial: "I showed up in Toronto with nothing but my gear and my OnRopePro profile. Started working that afternoon."

howItWorks.title: 30 seconds to set up. 10 years of protected career data.

step1.title: Create Your Account
step1.description: Enter your IRATA or SPRAT license number. Add your certifications. Upload your photo. Done.

step2.title: Connect With Employers
step2.description: When you join a company using OnRopePro, they send an invitation. Accept it. Your profile populates their system instantly. No forms. No redundant data entry.

step3.title: Work. Everything Logs Automatically.
step3.description: When connected to an employer on OnRopePro, every work session captures: date, building, height, tasks, duration. Grouped by project. Totaled by month and year.

step4.title: Export and Fill Your Physical Logbook
step4.description: Download your complete work history as PDF or CSV. Transfer accurate data into your physical IRATA/SPRAT logbook. Your assessor still checks your physical book-OnRopePro just makes sure the data in it is correct.

howItWorks.noteText: Your account works even without an employer on the platform. You can store certifications, track history manually, and access the job board (PLUS). But when your employer also uses OnRopePro? Everything supercharges-automatic hour tracking, instant onboarding, seamless documentation.
howItWorks.tellYourBoss: Tell your boss to check it out. You both win.

clarifications.warningTitle: THIS DOES NOT REPLACE YOUR PHYSICAL LOGBOOK
clarifications.warningText1: Your IRATA/SPRAT physical logbook is still required. OnRopePro is a digital assistant that gives you accurate data to transfer into your official logbook-it does not replace it.
clarifications.warningText2: IRATA and SPRAT certification bodies require you to maintain your physical logbook. That requirement hasn't changed. What has changed is how accurate your entries can be.
clarifications.beforeText: You guess at hours and details when filling your logbook weeks later
clarifications.afterText: You copy precise, timestamped data from OnRopePro into your logbook
clarifications.warningText3: Your assessor still checks your physical book. OnRopePro just makes sure the data in that book is right.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: Is the tech account really free?
faq.a1: Yes. Free forever. No credit card required. No time limits. No feature restrictions that suddenly lock you out.
faq.q2: What if my employer doesn't use OnRopePro?
faq.a2Intro: Your account still works. You can:
faq.a2List2: Import your existing logbook via photo
faq.a2Conclusion: What you won't get is automatic hour tracking-that only works when your employer is also on the platform. But here's the thing: when your employer joins, your account instantly upgrades. All that manual logging becomes automatic. Tell your boss.
faq.q3: How do I import my existing logbook?
faq.a3: Open the app, photograph your logbook pages, and the app reads your handwriting and extracts the data. Review, confirm, done. Years of historical hours imported in minutes-no manual data entry.
faq.q4: Does this replace my IRATA/SPRAT logbook?
faq.a4: No. You still need your physical logbook. IRATA and SPRAT require it. Your assessor will check it. OnRopePro is a digital assistant that captures accurate data so you can fill your physical logbook correctly-not a replacement for it.
faq.q5: What's the difference between automatic and manual logging?
faq.a5ManualText: You enter hours, buildings, and tasks yourself (or photograph your logbook to import). Works anytime, with or without an employer on the platform.
faq.a5AutoText: When your employer uses OnRopePro, your hours log automatically when you clock in/out. Building, height, tasks, duration-all captured without you entering anything. This is the real time-saver.
faq.q6: What happens to my data if I leave a company?
faq.a6: Your profile (certifications, work history, safety rating) stays with you permanently. Company-specific data (assigned gear, company documents) stays with that employer. Your core identity is always yours.
faq.a7: Refer one other technician who creates an account. You both get upgraded to PLUS automatically. No payment required.
faq.a8: AES-256-GCM encryption for all sensitive data. SOC2 Type II compliant infrastructure. PIPEDA compliant (Canada). Your SIN is completely optional.
faq.q9: Can employers see that I'm looking for other work?
faq.a9: No. Your job board activity is private. Employers see only what you explicitly share with them.
